Reviews.Title: “Updated room, location not so good!”
Reviews.Author: balloonr
Reviews.Content: The inside of the room was a treat given the exterior and location. Bathroom was huge and nicely appointed, wish I had time to take advantage of it. Very nicely furnished, if not a little tight but was only staying overnight for flight out. The wireless worked very well for all devices. Avoid rooms on 3rd floor where breakfast is as it was noisy. Parking is very small and you will have to hand over your keys if you aren't lucky enough to get a single parking spot. They double and triple park everyone and the front desk moves the cars around. They have a big pigeon problem and have the spikes all over the place, but my room was missing some and there were three birds nesting outside the window which was very noisy and not a pleasant noise. Someone had removed the screen from the window and was trying to the block where the pigeons were nesting but it didn't help. The location is on a busy street and there was a lot of activity. Not sure if it is the best area to be in. It was easy to get to the airport which was my main goal as I had an early morning flight and the price was very good given everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great find just know where the hotel is located before you book it.”
Reviews.Author: CruellaDenver
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this is a great place. Some people are not going to like it because of the location though. It was clean, spacious, quiet. The desk clerks were nice & helpful. The breakfast in the morning was your typical motel fair but good. The parking is the only weird thing. There are not enough spaces so you sometimes have to 'double up' cars in one long space. It was not the end of the world but just know that. Also, the neighborhood is not the highest class but I felt safe there. Just a place with lots of blue collar businesses (garages, mercados, etc.) around it. It's easy to find and easy access to the highway. Treat this nice place as your base camp for exploring LA. It's not a luxury hotel so just get some rest here and get out & explore.

Reviews.Title: “Right place, right price...for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: JTL61
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for just one night for our visit to Universal Studios and scored an excellent nightly rate on Priceline. Nearly every other reviewer has covered the bases. The location is good if you are thinking about being close to Universal. There is nothing around it except for the market and 7-11 across the street, both featuring homeless in the area. Not a real problem if you are looking for a decent night stay. The rooms are actually pretty nice. Everything worked well. Good flat panel TV, comfortable bed, separate sink from shower and ample space. No pool, hot tub or restaurant on site. Workout room is 3 machines. Short summary; in any other neighborhood, this hotel would be 3.5 stars. It worked well for us at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: PTO-Guy
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to stay near Universal Studios for 3 nights. Like Lostn Transit I didn't want to spend $180 a night plus $18 for parking at the hotel near Universal Studios so I decided to stay at this Best Western. My wife, my two kids, and I had a car so I didn't mind staying at this location, and we weren't going to stay out too late anyway. The hotel is in an industrial part of town as the reviewers say. I personally didn't think the location was as bad that some people made it out to be. Anyway, to get into the rooms of the hotel you would have to walk by the lobby/front desk. It's not a motel where you just park outside and walk to your door. Parking is inside and underneath the hotel and from there you walk to the lobby to get to all rooms. The rooms are clean and the beds are decent. This place is probably at most 2 years old so everything looks fairly new (except for the worn towels). Instead of curtains, they have shutters. There is a minifridge, microwave, AC/fan, and 27" flat screen TV. The complimentary breakfast was decent. It had the basic danishes, bread, muffins, hard boiled eggs or scrambled eggs, cereal, oatmeal, and OJ. Also you can make your own waffles but there might be a line for that. One of the complaints I had was that the shower head was one of those low flow ones, so you can't take a super quick shower. However, probably because of the low flows, there is always super hot water even during the morning rush (which even at nicer hotels is problematic). I also thought that the small hair dryer was a little weaker than the normal small hairdryers found at these hotels. Parking can be a problem but I was lucky to park on the side where you are not blocked for 2 nights. The other night I parked on the doubles side where you can get blocked. I did get blocked but in the morning the front desk person was able to move the truck out for me to get out. (You have to leave your key at the front desk if you are parking on the doubles side and are on the outside blocking some other vehicle). Universal Studios is about a 20-25 minute drive. Hollywood is probably another 10 minutes away. There is a Ralph's and CVS which is about a 2 minute drive. I wouldn't stay here without a car. I didn't see the buses at all so the wait is probably quite long.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - 3 nights spent Feb. 2012”
Reviews.Author: LostinTransit10
Reviews.Content: Just finished three nights at the Best Western Burbank Airport hotel. I was traveling in LA with a larger group. They were staying at a Universal City hotel that was $180+. a night plus $18. for parking. That was more than what I wanted to spend, so I elected to save the $ and say a "short" distance away. The front desk staff was great all three times I encountered them. The room was very clean. In fact, I am not sure how old this building is, but based on the condition of my room, I would guess less than a year. All the furnishing/bath/bed were in excellent shape. The room was much larger than most I stay in. If the was one minus, it was that I could here TV and kids voices through the walls between about 8 and 11 pm. I always travel with ear plugs to I used them. That managed to block out about 90% of the noise - enough to fall asleep. I had a car, so I did not walk anywhere in the area surrounding the hotel. I had looked at it using google maps before I made the reservation and could tell based on experience that It would not be healthy for me to venture out. I drove into the under building parking lot each evening and drove out again the following morning. If I were you, I would plan on doing the same. I felt very safe driving to and from the hotel. The parking is free. The continental breakfast was OK. Also free. I paid under $90. per night (including tax). It was worth every penny. Finally, the trip up from Universal City in the evening was a short 10-15 minutes drive. From the hotel to Universal City in morning rush hour was a tense 40 minutes in bumper to bumper, stop and go traffic. The pic of the room does not do it justice. The photo captures maybe 1/5 of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Have No Fear”
Reviews.Author: MarktheYank
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived on December 30, 2011, for an eight day stay at this property. He is from England, and I live in the southern United States. We chose this location because it appeared to be fairly centrally located to Universal and Warner Brothers studios, which were among our top destinations, and was also close to the local Metro station (yes, we used publc transportation rather than renting a car). First of all, as described by other reviewers, the hotel is located in an industrial, working class area, with a predominately Hispanic population. We are two white guys and stood out like sore thumbs. Admittedly, at first I was somewhat uneasy with the location simply because I knew nothing about the area or how its residents would react to us. However, my fears were quickly allayed the first night. We walked, in the dark, down the street to Jimmy's Burgers. Not only were we not bothered by anyone, the staff at Jimmy's were very friendly and served us a delicious and much appreciated meal. That broke the ice for me, and from that point on, we just blended into the neighborhood, whether it was shopping for groceries at Superior or getting a quick snack across the street at 7-Eleven. Everywhere where we went, we were polite and courteous and treated everyone with respect, and that is what we received in return. My advice to anyone staying in this hotel is to have no fear. The residents of this neighborhood are nice people. Be cautious, as you should anywhere, but don't judge the area soley by its appearance. As for the hotel, I booked through priceline, com. My room, like previous reviewer Brittany, faced the preschool next door. It did become noisy after 9AM, but shutting the window suppressed most of the noise, and we were usually gone sightseeing by 10AM, so that really was not a bother. The room itself was very clean, spacious, and well-appointed with a massive king sized bed that was very comfortable. Unlike others, we had no problem with the breakfast. Depending on the time, it could be very crowded or practically dead. They menu offered hard-boiled eggs every day, except weekends which had scrambled eggs. Self serve waffles were available every day, as was toast, danish and muffins, four different cereals (2 sweet, 2 healthier), fruit, coffee, teas, and juices. My partner ate in the breakfast room every day. I'm a late sleeper, so I usually went up for my meal about 8:30 and carried a plate back to my room, an alternative for those who find it too small, warm, or crowded. Breakfast is complimentary, and you have a mini-fridge to keep leftovers. We had no problems with any of the staff. All of the housekeeping ladies were friendly and very efficient. We had fresh towels every day without asking. Most of the desk clerks were helpful, the two standouts being Juan (morning clerk) and the gentleman who worked the afternoon/early evening shift. In short, the property was clean, spacious, and a good value for our needs. I would defintely stay there again should I return. Other hotels in the area were much pricier and not necessarily any safer. Personally, we enjoyed being a small part of the neighborhood along Metro line 224. For us, blending into the culture rather than standing apart from it as mere tourists is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean, & Practical”
Reviews.Author: shangot
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel to stay the night to catch an early flight in the morning. This hotel is near the airport but you still need to use the freeway. It's also walking distance from Ralph's, CVS & Ross. Unfortunately the breakfast area is so small it can only fit 4 chairs... imagine? Food options range from bread, eggs, cereal & fruit... so not bad. But nonetheless, bathrooms are clean, carpets look clean, beds are comfy and sheets are clean. The room (king bed) is bigger than most hotels and it also includes a mini-ref, bath tub as well as iron and blow dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Newer Hotel... However you might wanna read my comments”
Reviews.Author: calguysactown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new and the room I was in was clean and updated. However, the morning breakfast (which was supposed to start at 0600-9000 hrs - rarely began at 0600) was never open at 6:00 a.m. when I needed to leave the hotel. It would open at 6:12-6:15 daily-I stuck around one morning to see how long it would take the maid to open it up; I complained about this nothing was done to correct the issue. If you need high speed Internet, this isn't the place for you; my speed-test on several occasions was less than 1 mbps, often came in for downloads at .78 mbps (slightly faster than dial-up). Also, the hotel is not really close to anything; it is in a mostly commercial/industrial area away from major shopping/dining areas. Oh, and if you happen to get this place on Priceline.com get ready for a room facing a very noisy and busy major thoroughfare (these are the ONLY rooms available for Priceline guests). I attempted to change rooms the first night but was told that I would have to contact Priceline.com and pay an additional fee to get a quieter room. Just as few objective observations about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Very Quiet, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: nelsons4christ
Reviews.Content: We love having breakfast and this one was very nice! Good variety! The room was very clean! Almost too clean - they would remove our partially used soap and shampoo, so we started putting them away in order not to waste. This was a good location to Warner Bros., Huntington Library, Dodger's Stadium and The Getty, all places we visited during our stay. We chose this location because of cost and proximity to what we wanted to do. The parking is a little funky, but for us it worked out great. The neighborhood is a little worn, but we didn't go their to walk in the neighborhood. We felt safe and comfortable during our stay. The pillow top mattresses were a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Shady area, parking a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: happyandretiredkf318
Reviews.Content: The area and parking would have been a deal breaker had I known what I know now. The other reviews stated it wasn't so bad. Ok, so why do all the buildings around have bars on the windows and very high fences around their property? It is a bad area, and there are gang signs on the property just across the street. The majority of parking is tandem so if you have to park blocking another car you have to turn in your car keys to the clerk at the desk. Not so terrible unless you happen to be blocked in by a person who did not turn in their car keys or leave any information of who the car belongs to. This happened on our very first night. We came back to the hotel around 10 in the evening and a couple were trying to leave. A very large SUV was blocking their car and no one at the hotel knew who it belong to and did not have the keys. They finally were able to move all the cars on both sides and slowly inch their way out but it made me very wary of being parked there after that. Now the breakfast room. It is on the third floor, heat rises correct? Well it is the exact size of the hotel room. The bedroom is all the seating there is and all the food is in what is the size of the bathroom. All the hot appliances, coffee pot, waffle maker, toaster are all going with no AC vent, no fan, nothing to cool the room off. It had to be 110 degrees in there. I guess they wanted to make sure no one stayed long. The hotel is very new, rooms are very nice, but I would not recommend staying there unless you are very brave and take a taxi. I spoke with most of the clerks at the front desk over the few days we were there and none of them were very helpful about giving directions in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the area. Clean & Modern Decor.”
Reviews.Author: greecelightning
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a decent price, decently decorated and nice staff. The front desk guys were accomodating. The breakfast & housekeeping staff were also nice. The decor was clean and modern. The breakfast was in a cute small room, with a decent selection of foods. The exercise room was small, but clean. The main machine wasn't working. The location was nice-close to Burbank airport. Add a pool, and voila, you have a decent place at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Cheap rates”
Reviews.Author: shebri50
Reviews.Content: My husband and adult children recently visited LA to check out the tourist attractions. We were very impressed with this hotel but were initially skeptical as the prices were low. However, we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were modernly decorated and very clean. Each of our rooms had a microwave and mini fridge which is always nice for leftovers and water. Our continental breakfast was perfect and much appreciated-my husband enjoyed fresh waffles every morning while I enjoyed cerial and toast. My boys all enjoyed the selection of pastries as well as some scrambled eggs and juice. We were extremely happy with the helpful desk staff. Every time we asked for directions or suggestions of places to eat and shop, they were quick to help and even printed off directions for us. The location of this hotel was also great as was pretty central to where we needed to go. Definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good price!”
Reviews.Author: SueAnn A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here when we went to a business party at the Magic Castle back in September. We were on a budget and all hotels (even dirty motels) in the West Hollywood area were way too expensive. We booked the Best Western for about 70 dollars through Name Your Price on Priceline. We arrived at 4pm and checked in without any line or hassles. The room was fantastic! It was big (the bathroom was HUGE) and had plantation shutters with a window we could actually open (I love fresh air in hotel rooms). The television was a big flat screen and we brought our dvd player to hook up to it. We also brought our laptop since they had FREE wifi! It only took us 10 minutes to get to the Magic Castle in West Hollywood. We noticed Universal City is super close to the hotel (we passed exits for Universal Studios within 3 minutes of driving). Upon arriving back at the hotel (around 2am) the parking garage was near capacity. There was one spot available on the double car side, so we had to drop our keys at the front desk so that they could move our car if the person parked in front of us needed to get out. This was basically the only con of our trip. I do not feel comfortable leaving our ONE keypad to our brand new car with a complete stranger in Los Angeles. Oh well, though! Breakfast in the morning was pretty good. They had a waffle maker, muffins, eggs, cereal, and english muffins. I've had better breakfasts, but for the price we paid for the room, this one was good! All in all, this hotel is new, clean, and pretty conveniently located. Other than the neighborhood it's in (kind of shady...dirty neighborhood) and the parking situation, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone who's on a budget looking for a nice place to stay in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: Richland34
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple, clean hotel close to Grace Community Church where I would be attending a 4 day conference. Since the commute would be daily, I was looking foremost at proximity and price. What I got was way beyond my expectations! The hotel is in an area which would have otherwise caused me to pass over it. Even though the grounds and facility are immaculate, I would have been distracted by the rough-looking neighborhood. However, since I went largely by TripAdvisor ratings, I was confident in my choice and didn't flinch when I drove right up. Check in was efficient and speedy. My room was fantastic. I have stayed in Hilton's which were inferior to what I had at this hotel. Clean, crisp decoration, nice furniture, very comfortable bed and excellent TV and wi-fi. My room was right across fromt the complimentary hot breakfast which was great. I didn't bother with the room coffee since I could go across the hall and get the "real thing" without the fuss. The hotel had a small fitness room but I didn't use it. Looked like it would do the job though. I was hungry for lunch and wasn't sure if I could try to walk somewhere or not. I checked with the front desk and was referred to a Mexican seafood specialty restaurant on the diagonal corner. I took the suggestion and was very happy that I did. Do not be overly concerned about the suspicious-looking surroundings. This place is a GEM and you will be happy you stayed at the Best Western Burbank Airport Inn.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: teebees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of a two weeks long vacation in Florida, San Francisco and Los Angeles. Of all the hotels we stayed, we liked this better. We had one or the other to complain about in almost all the hotels but this was refreshing and surprising for a change. The room was clean, had all the amenities, everything was in working condition, continental breakfast was nice, and there was free parking. Parking is limited, may be cramped at night when spaces fill up and left turn to hotel from the opposite side of the road is not legal. Breakfast items can be replenished a little more often but that is based on two days of observation only. This place is a little than five miles from the main LA attractions but with a rented car, we could enjoy all of them.

Reviews.Title: “great place, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: nycchic86
Reviews.Content: although not in a particularly fancy area of town, this hotel greatly exceeded my expectations! the rooms were large, clean, and fully equipped. i don't know where else i could have stayed in north hollywood for such great value. i never felt unsafe, staff was courteous and accomodating, breakfast was more than adequate, and amenities were plentious. bathrooms had an enormous amount of counter space, and the shower worked perfectly. plenty of restuarants and shopping are less than 15 minutes away, as are universal studios and hollywood boulevard. i have zero complaints about this hotel as i was expecting something not quite up to par, but best western burbank airport inn thoroughly impressed me. i would highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire Customer??? Get Ready For A Noisy Roadside Room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: xflyboy
Reviews.Content: The Pluses - Very Nice Practically New Property with Impecable Rooms and Free Parking & Breakfast. The Minuses are the rather dismal, depressing area its in but mostly if you got this through Hotwire then be prepared for a very noisy roadside room with Managements indifferent, unsympathetic attitude towards you. Even with other empty available rooms - management will NOT move you! They have branded Hotwire customers as second class citizens to get the noisy rooms. Unless you purchase directly through the hotel be prepared for these rooms. I've been travelling for my entire life and career and I've never encountered this attitude ever. I'll never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, area not great”
Reviews.Author: carolinemc94
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it served what we wanted it for. the breakfast was an added to cereal, toast, pasteries, eggs etc. area was not great a few shady characters hanging about but if your driving the price is right and the hotel is very comfy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort and value”
Reviews.Author: Mishkamitten
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights here to start our stay in LA. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was large and spotlessly clean with an enormous bed, pillow topped mattress, widescreen TV and air-conditioning. Bonuses were free parking, free wifi, free use of business centre and complimentary breakfast (Continental). The room also had a fridge and microwave and a short way up the road are a couple of big foodstores, so if you want to buy food and chill out in your room, it's easy. The only downside is the location, which is a bit rundown, but if like us you are touring and will be out all day, so only need a comfortable place to sleep, this could be just what you are looking for. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in LA at a great rate!”
Reviews.Author: BSpeaker
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Free parking (you must double park at night if the lot is full. The front desk will move your car as needed). - New property. - Complimentary breakfast (on 3rd floor). - Flat screen TV. - Large beds. - Keyless entry. - 3-star Hotwire rate around $55. - Close to shopping and food (1-2 mile drive). - Neighborhood may seem like a lower-grade, but it was very quiet through the stay. - Big microwave & refrigerator in all rooms. - Very, very clean. - Large bathrooms. Cons: - Smallish rooms (because of large beds so a fair trade).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but dicey area”
Reviews.Author: gracieg
Reviews.Content: I'd have to agree with the other reviewers. The hotel is nice and I never ventured around the immediate area. We only stayed one night and mostly got in and out of the car to attend the UCLA graduation which is about 1/2 hour away.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable”
Reviews.Author: FabioR2
Reviews.Content: The area is not so great, but it is safe. The hotel is fairly new. The rooms are large and comfortable. Breakfast, free parking and free wifi are great pluses!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, cleanliness & quality”
Reviews.Author: London_E14
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, all brand new. Location is in an industrial area but there are restaurants and shops within a few minutes' drive, for example at the large strip mall on West Empire (next to the 5 freeway).

Reviews.Title: “Could not resist writing a review”
Reviews.Author: jonesbkr
Reviews.Content: I do not normally take the time to write a great review but had to on this hotel. I booked it for the price. As we got close to the hotel, I was skeptical because of the area. The parking area appeared very secure. The lobby was a great surprise but the rooms were the best surprise. Very nice decorations, bedding and amenities. This place is a jewel near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and clean room!”
Reviews.Author: Arn-Elle
Reviews.Content: At first I was uncertain about the hotel because of the area we were in. It wasn't the best area but not scary by any means. I guess I was just expecting more shops instead of small grocery marts. The plus side is that it is very close to Universal Studios and there are several fast food restaurants if you want a quick bite to eat. The guy at the front desk was very helpful. We got in a little later but didn't want to stay couped up in the hotel room. He suggested we go to a mall nearby which was actually a great mall! The room had everything we needed, it was very clean and you can tell it was just newly renovated. The hotel also had a great continental breakfast and we found that the staff were really nice and polite. When we checked out I accidently left my leather jacket in the closet (actually my FAVORITE leather jacket!!). I called a few hours later when I realized I left it and inquired about it. The front desk already knew about it and suggested they can send the jacket to me by mail and just charge my credit card for the shipping cost. I received my jacket about 3.5 weeks later in the same condition and it only cost me $7 for the shipping as opposed to buying a new leather jacket for $300! Overall, we thought this hotel was great! It was a great value, close to attractions, staff were accomodating and polite, and rooms were new and clean. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fuzzypuppy
Reviews.Content: On the whole, my stay wasn't horrible but I was very disappointed. This hotel was recently renovated so it was very nicely decorated and had no major maintenance issues. The breakfast was decent but the breakfast room was tiny (there were only 4 tables) and got over-crowded very quickly. The parking situation was weird and there wasn't nearly enough. On one side of the lot were stalls 1 car length deep. If you could get one one of those spots every night you were fine. On the other side of the lot stalls were 2 car lengths deep. If you got to a stall first you were blocked in by the second car and had to wait for it to be moved if you needed to leave. If you got there second you either had to give your keys to the front desk or come down and move the car yourself when the front desk called. Then there was the fruit. Apparently the people in the room previously had left some fruit on a shelf and it rolled back to be hidden from view. The cleaning staff missed it and it began to rot. When I noticed it I reported it to the front desk and asked for it to be cleaned up during the daily room cleaning. When I got back that evening it still had not been done. To his credit, the front desk guy got some cleaning supplies and cleaned it up, but he shouldn't have had to. Then, the room safe was broken and even after having someone in to fix it, it did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidPortland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in mid September. As others have said, the location is a little "rough" but certainly not scary. The hotel is 3 miles from Burbank Airport but there is no shuttle so a car is necessary for access. The BW Burbank Airport Inn is a very well maintain facility built above a parking garage. Outside the back of the parking garage is an attractive space with waterfall, lawn and two outdoor tables with umbrellas. The inside space is attractive with a small business center, breakfast room and fitness center. Rooms are pleasant with flat screen TV and very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor, lacking finer details.”
Reviews.Author: JaiTea
Reviews.Content: There were six of us (three couples) staying here for over a week (7, turned into 8 nights) for a family reunion. First, it should be said that there is little to look at in this area. It's located on Lankershim which features great accessibility to attractions that (thankfully) saves you from entering the highway system. Unfortunately, the area it is located in is a decidedly less nice location. Late at night, you don't have to go very far to see prostitutes on corners and some shady dealings. This doesn't mean you're risking your life to stay here, but if you're bringing a family with small children (we're all well old enough), then the area is probably not the best. The front desk was incredibly accommodating and got to know us after frequently seeing us in and out everyday. The breakfast is pretty typical hotel fare; nothing special. The room itself, however, had good and bad about it. On the one hand, it was clear the hotel was new. Walls, carpets, beds, and all felt fresh and unruined. The windows inside the room (large slat-like blinds) were very nice to see upon entering, but having spent several days, you begin to see little things that cheapen the room; this mainly deals with the actual construction. Our room, for example, featured a bathroom door that would not properly close (the doorjam wasn't built at the correct depth), floor molding that gradually separated from the carpet along the wall (it went from having no gap near the door, to nearly a half-inch gap in the other corner), broken remote controls (you would have to hold it upside down and at an angle to get it to work), and a broken door sensor. The sensor was annoying, very much so. If your door happens to not close all the way, a loud beeping noise emits to make you aware to close the door. Unfortunately, any time we left or entered the room, this sensor would go off regardless of whether the door was closed. We told the front desk and they gave us a flimsy "it's supposed to do that" excuse (this only occurred with one of the other couples). It was annoying coming home late to listen to the noise for those several seconds and, seeing as one of us fell ill in the room, it would constantly awaken anyone trying to sleep in the bedroom. All in all, these were small inconveniences that I feel could be improved to make an average stay even better. As is, it's not a terrible place to stay and the only legitimate complaint I found was the area it was built in. If that's not an issue for people, then there's no reason to not stay, really.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: COnative31
Reviews.Content: We were a late arrival and were very apprehensive about the location of the hotel once we got to the area. It was a very pleasant surprise to find out that parking was "covered" and monitored. The rooms and upkeep of the hotel was great. Prior to our arrival at the BW we were staying at a Doubletree that did not compare concerning the room appearance, comfort, and quietness. It was a good value. Don't let the neighborhood persuade you from staying overnight at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, new hotel, horrible neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: travel02568
Reviews.Content: all of the reviews are true. i stayed here for a week for work. the hotel is brand new nice rooms, flat screen tv, and clean. however i have friends in the la area and wanted to grab dinner during the evening. I did not feel safe leaving my room after dark. the parking is very well lit but it is in an la ghetto. the staff agreed that i should not go out after dark. so you know that is a sign. the hotel would be okay if you had to stay for a few days and understood that you should leave the hotel after dark and do not walk around the neighborhood. the breakfast comments are also accurate, the food was all left uncovered and with nothing to keep the eggs for example cold. the price was great and the rooms were clean obviously because it is a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, questionable location.”
Reviews.Author: justice5
Reviews.Content: Pros: In July 2010 this hotel looked brand new. Our room was a very spacious two bedroom suite with two king beds and two bathrooms. It was very clean and quiet except for the city traffic noise outside. My 11 year old son loved having his own bed and tv. We paid only $109 with our AAA discount. We had a short 15 minute drive to universal studios. Parking is free and is located under the hotel. Looks fairly secure for this area. Cons: Honestly, it is like someone took a beautiful hotel, picked it up and plopped it smack in the middle of a very questionable area. The security cameras in the lobby kind of give it away. Now, we had absolutely no problems here any d we found everyone to be friendly and helpful. But, my "mom radar" was in high alert upon check in. I certainly would not feel safe walking around at night in this neighborhood. I think I see why the room was so cheap now. Also, although they give you a free breakfast, there is a very small breakfast room and many food items were left completely uncovered and unrefrigerated for several hours....especially an uncovered plate of hard boiled eggs...no refrigeration and no cover. Think of little kids fingering everything in reach....yuck! We went to the donut shop next door and had donuts instead.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: harleychic28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem. Honestly, my first impression was " oh boy, what have I gotten ouselves into" because of the neighborhood. But first impressions are not always right! The hotel staff was very friendly and courteous. The room was spacious and bed quite comfy. I would definately stay here again. My only complaint was the complimentary breakfast. (I know.. it was free) but on a scale from 1 to 10, I would rate it a solid 4. The food was pretty stale. But don't let that stop you from stopping through. The manager, Juan Adriano, was very responsive and plans to make some changes. We'll see Juan...the next time we visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever...”
Reviews.Author: ronnybaby
Reviews.Content: The price, hospitality, location...everything was excellent! It was very comfortable. We stayed in a two room suite. The rooms were totally separated by a wall and had separate bathrooms, microwaves, refridgerators, tvs, couches...The only thing is you have to go through the first room to get into the second one. Breakfast was free, so was parking. Hotel is very close to Burbank Airport and only a few miles from LA.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to Universal Studio”
Reviews.Author: pilipina
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient if you going to visit the Universal studio. We took a bus #224 just across the road to universal city for $1.25 oneway trip then there's a free shuttle at the end of the line to take you to the universal studio. The room was spacious and clean and the free breakfast was ok. I will stay here a again. The hotel is located at the busy main road and lots of private fastfood shop but be aware not to walk or hang around to longoutside, desn't look safe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an old part of North Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: CiteCR
Reviews.Content: I booked a handicapped room with 2 beds. We were given a suite with two separate bedrooms. Each had it's own set of amenities. The rooms are spacious, well lit, airy and clean. Each room had its own temperature control. Beds are very comfortable. Free Wi-Fi, a great continental breakfast and friendly service. Our housekeeper's name was Claudia; she did a great job. I strongly recommend tipping the housekeepers; they work hard! This is an older part of North Hollywood. There is covered parking in a drive-in garage connected to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest staff”
Reviews.Author: JamieA6
Reviews.Content: I will try to be brief but during my recent stay the weekend of 2/21/10 I had my ring stolen from my room by the cleaning staff. Nothing was ever turned in and this hotel has done nothing but said oh we're sorry and that the staff never turns in lost items. Needless to say I will never stay here again. I never have been so violated. So if you have to stay at least leave valuables in the car. The front desk attendant even went on to say he suspects who stole the ring but they are just lying. I even offered a reward for it's return but nothing. don't stay here they didn't even do anything to resolve the situation not even a simple incident report just a phone convo and a sorry email. I was completely disgusted. On another note the rooms are very clean, i'm shocked the previous person found hairs in their bed. But the person who cleaned their roomed is probably the person who stole my ring. I actually stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions valentine's day weekend and the following weekend. But as I previously stated I will not return. Also the neighborhood is not that bad. But i'm from San Francisco and can deal with the hustle and bustle of the city.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Burbank Airport Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 7615 Lankershim Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 91605-2814
